forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear. Low around 46, with temperatures rising to around 48 overnight. Northwest wind 6 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As midday unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a muted chill lingers in the air. The clouds, thick and brooding, cast a soft gray veil over the city. There’s the scent of impending rain, a whisper suggesting that the moisture may soon punctuate the forecasted afternoon with a brief but welcomed shower. Temperatures dance around the mid-fifties, a fleeting warmth that teeters gently before succumbing once more to the encroaching coolness of the afternoon wind, nudging through with the familiar saltiness of the bay. 

As daylight fades into evening, the sky offers the promise of clarity, lifting to reveal the twinkling lights of the cityscape once more as darkness descends. With a low resting at 46 degrees, you might find comfort in layering, perhaps a soft sweater underneath a light jacket to ward off the bite of the northwest breeze. In these elusive hours of dusk, a stroll along the Embarcadero could serve well, allowing the rhythm of the city to envelop you, where the echoes of laughter and the murmur of waves harmoniously blend into the evening. Alternatively, a quiet retreat to one of the many cozy cafes to sip warm brew while observing the gentle ebb and flow of life around you feels simply right.
